Desc.entry: Part of Sheffield Libraries, Archives and Information. Based in, and in partnership with, Zest (formerly Upperthorpe Healthy Living Centre, see separate entry). Stock and facilities include: CDs, DVDs, videos and talking books. Community language materials in Arabic, Chinese, Somali and Urdu. Activities include homework club and Councillors' surgeries. Provides 8 People's Network computers with Microsoft Office, Internet access, a scanner and colour printer available for public use. Also provides health information and an advice service Tel 270 2040 (Zest reception). ZEST also has a colour photocopier.

ProviderServiceDetails.entry: Mon-Fri 9.30am-5.30pm, Sat 9.30am-12.30pm (staffed opening times); Mon-Fri 7.30am-9pm, Sat 7.30am-6pm, Sun 7.30am-3pm (self-issue service, except for audio/visual materials); Mon 10.30-11.30am (Baby Time), Monday mornings (Health Walks), Tues & Fri 10am-12.30pm (Langsett Advice Service session), Fri 9am-12noon (Sheffield Occupational Health Advice Service), 2nd Mon in the month 6-7pm (Upperthorpe Reading Group, see separate entry), 1st Sat in the month 10-11am (Councillors surgery)
